intro: Axiniphyllum scabrum, commonly known as rough axiniphyllum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
